intro: Aldama amphichlora, commonly known as the two-leaved alder, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Betulaceae, which includes birches and alders. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
